intro: Nolana lachimbensis, commonly known as the Lachimba nolana, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, and it thrives in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and slopes, where it contributes to local biodiversity. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
